availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses Nathan Hall (Woodford County, Kentucky, waggoner, farmer, and town marshal)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, waggoner, town marshal. Kentucky native. Married to Malinda Filson Hall in Woodford County, Kentucky, on September 25, 1855. Father of A. E. Hall, Nattie Hall, Mollie Hall, and Bartie Hall. Waggoner in Woodford County in 1860. Employed John Taylor as a waggoner in Woodford County in 1860. Farmer in Woodford County in 1863. Town marshal of Versailles, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 962.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 530A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320, p. 50 of 279 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Woodford County, KY, July 1863, p. 205 of 370 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Moses Nathan Hall (1830-1892)," Memorial #195620006, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/195620006(accessed January 28, 2021).
KYR-0001-004-0304.
